articles.title: Kim Jong Il Deeply Respected by Jong Ju Yong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Deeply Respected by Jong Ju Yong
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- It is ten years since Jong Ju Yong, former honorary chairman of the Hyundai Group of south Korea, passed away.
					Jong Ju Yong had deeply respected General Secretary Kim Jong Il as the sun of the nation and the central figure for the country's reunification and great national unity till the last moments of his life since he met the leader.
					
					 When Jong met Kim Jong Il whom he had so ardently longed to see during his visit to Pyongyang late in October 1998, he said in an excited tone "Kim Jong Il is the greatest general, indeed."
					
					 General Kim Jong Il is intrepid, open-hearted and broad-minded, he told his friends, adding that after meeting him he felt as if the country had already become one.
					
					  Jong went on to say: 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il is a distinguished great man as I was told. He warmly shook my hands, reposing trust in me who has been engaged only in business in this divided land. He is the kind-hearted and broad-minded hero who will lead my country and my nation to harmony and reunification.
					
					 I made up my mind to devote my remaining years to the sacred cause of reunification, confident that he is the only leader whom I should trust and follow.
					
					 Jong was completely attracted by the personality of Kim Jong Il as a great man. He was interviewed by a reporter of the south side as regards his impressions of Pyongyang visit. When questioned why he addressed Kim Jong Il General, Jong asked the reporter if there was anything wrong when he called Kim Jong Il General as the whole world is doing so, exciting all those present. 
					
					 South Koreans still remember with deep emotion Jong Ju Yong who so deeply respected Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Chairman of Chongryon
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Chairman of Chongryon
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of sympathy to So Man Sul, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), in connection with the fact that Chongryon and compatriots suffered huge human and material losses due to the killer earthquake and tsunami that hit vast areas centered on the Tohoku region of Japan. 
					 In the message Kim Yong Nam noted that it is a demonstration of the united might of Chongryon that after the sudden occurrence of the disastrous quake its Central Standing Committee took emergency measures and is conducting positive rescue activities to protect the precious lives and properties of the compatriots in the quake-hit areas. 
					
					 The message expressed sincere hope that all the organizations of Chongryon and compatriots would eradicate the aftermath of the quake as early as possible by displaying indomitable will, warm compatriotism and concerted efforts and ensure the stable life of the above-said compatriots.

articles.title: Indonesian Ministry Delegation Here
articles.content:
Indonesian Ministry Delegation Here
						
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Indonesian Ministry for Communication and Information Technology led by Secretary General Basuki Yusuf Iskandar arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Production of Vinalon Cloth Begins
articles.content:
Production of Vinalon Cloth Begins
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The officials and workers of the Hamhung Woolen Mill in the DPRK began producing vinalon cloth. They built a modern process of spinning vinalon band into thread.
					 The converting and spinning shop was rebuilt, laying a solid foundation for weaving any vinalon cloth as wished. Vinalon finally became to prove its worth in improving the people's living standard and developing the country's industry.
					
					 The engineering shop, the maintenance shop and the auxiliary parts shop of the mill solved scientific and technological problems in close touch with officials and technicians of the Ministry of Light Industry and the Management Bureau for Textile Industry. They succeeded in making more than 140 kinds of nearly 100,000 key and auxiliary parts.
					
					 The technological updating and power and intra-networking for the efficient provision of temperature and humidity of worksites also made brisk headway, providing conditions for finishing the reconstruction of production process ahead of schedule.
					
					 The officials and workers of the mill pushed forward the huge project of installing dozens of fiber processing equipment at the February 8 Vinalon Complex at the same time, thus making it possible to complete the production processes in a rational way.
					
					 Officials in Pyongyang and province rendered active help to the workers of the mill in updating equipment. This resulted in the establishment of simple yet profitable vinalon cloth production system.

articles.title: New Voltage-current Transformer Developed
articles.content:
New Voltage-current Transformer Developed
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Electronic Institute of the DPRK has developed a new electronic voltage-current transformer.
					 The small device measures voltage and current simultaneously in 60,000 volts line.
					
					 Rational sensing, signaling and screening technologies are applied to the device.
					
					 The transformer works fine even in high-voltage electromagnetic field.
					
					 Its manufacture needs no insulating oil and economizes manpower and materials like insulator, silicon steel sheet and enameled copper wire.
					
					The new transformer is accurate in measurement, protection and synchronization, sharply reducing the number of switchboards.

articles.title: History of Postage Stamps
articles.content:
History of Postage Stamps
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, the DPRK observed the 65th anniversary of the first stamps in the country.
					 The first stamps "Althea" and "Samsonam" were brought out on March 12, Juche 35 (1946).
					
					 A stamp with a picture of President Kim Il Sung was issued to commemorate August 15 that year, the first anniversary of the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule.
					
					 Sixteen kinds of stamps came out in the period of the building of a new country, including "Owner of Land" and "2nd Anniversary of Labor Law".
					
					 "Liberation of Seoul", "For the Final Victory", "Day of Struggle against U.S. Imperialists", "May Day", "DPRK-China Friendship", "4th World Festival of Youth and Students" and other stamps were published in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Many souvenir stamps were also brought out in the periods of postwar rehabilitation and construction, socialist construction and the "Arduous March", the forced march.
					
					 Many of the stamps published in the country show achievements made in the political, military, economic and cultural fields.

articles.title: Kalsan Hot Spring
articles.content:
Kalsan Hot Spring
						
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Kalsan Cure in Phangyo County, Kangwon Province, has been visited by many people for medical treatment.
					 The cure has a hot spring well known from 500 years ago.
					
					 The temperature of the spring is 46-47 degrees C, its pH is 8.4 and the quantity of water gushing out a day is 350 cubic meters.
					
					 The spa water contains metasilicic acid, hydrogen sulfide, radon, bicarbonate, sulfuric acid, sodium and calcium ions.
					
					 The alkaline water promotes the circulation of blood and metabolism and gives an anodyne effect.
					
					 It is also good for chronic gastritis, obesity, neuralgia, trauma and aftereffect of operation.
					
					 The Kalsan hot spring was registered as a national heritage in Juche 98 (2009).

articles.title: Moran Hill in Spring
articles.content:
Moran Hill in Spring
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- As spring has fairly set in, an increasing number of people are enjoying themselves in Moran Hill in Pyongyang.
					 The picturesque hill has many relics telling ancient legends about the long history of Pyongyang.
					
					 There are the crane-shaped Ulmil Pavilion and the Pubyok Pavilion conveying a story of a famous poet who broke off his writing brush finally after he failed to compose a poem of the hill scenery.
					
					 The Chongnyu and Choesung pavilions and the Chilsong Gate in the hill commands a panoramic view of Pyongyang.
					
					 The hill has facilities for such folk games as swinging and ssirum (Korean wrestling).
					
					 Around the hill are Kim Il Sung Stadium, Arch of Triumph, Moranbong Theater, Moran Restaurant and Kaeson Youth Park.

articles.title: Tug of War
articles.content:
Tug of War 
						
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Tug of war has a long history in Korea.
					 In the period of the three kingdoms (Koguryo, Paekje and Silla), Korean people built many irrigation canals. During breaks in embankment, they used to play tug of war.
					
					 The winner team owned the rope and used it for embankment, believing that it would enable them to do farming well, free from worry about water, and harvest a bumper crop.
					
					 The rope was usually made of rice straw. 
					
					 During the game all villagers cheered their team and the winners celebrated their victory, singing and dancing all night.
					
					 The traditional folk game is still popular in the country as it is good for physical training and unity of collective.

articles.title: Kwangjong Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Kwangjong Revolutionary Site
						
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) --The revolutionary site in Kwangjong-ri, Sungho County, North Hwanghae Province, is associated with the revolutionary activities of Kim Hyong Jik.
					 He devoted himself to the struggle for the independence of the country and the freedom and emancipation of the people.
					
					 He visited the village several times between 1911 and 1921 to conduct energetic activities for liberating the country from the Japanese colonial rule.
					
					 He inspired the villagers with the spirit of national independence and anti-Japanese patriotic ideas and aroused them in the struggle for the country's liberation.
					
					 He formed the Kwangjong Association, a legitimate organization, and led its members to store up grain reserves and grasp the conditions of major ferries.
					
					 In the revolutionary site there are a swinging site where Kim Hyong Jik enlightened women fettered by feudal customs and a ssirum (Korean wrestling) site where he gave military knowledge to young people and inspired them with national pride.
					
					 Many people have visited the revolutionary site on the occasion of the 94th anniversary of the Korean National Association formed by him.

articles.title: First Tax-Free Country in World
articles.content:
First Tax-Free Country in World
						
Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- On March 21, Juche 63 (1974), a historic law was promulgated in the DPRK to abolish taxation.
					 On this occasion, the Korean people are most grateful to President Kim Il Sung for the abolition of taxation in the country for the first time in the world.
					
					 He, in the "Ten-point Programme of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland" published in the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle, put forth a policy of removing all kinds of heavy miscellaneous taxes and levies imposed by the Japanese imperialists on the Korean people.
					
					 After the liberation of the country, he established a popular and democratic tax system, mainly including agricultural tax in kind and progressive income tax.
					
					 In 1955 the DPRK government reduced income taxes for factory and office workers by 30 percent and taxes for handicraftsmen, businessmen and merchants by a wide margin. It also cut the agricultural tax in kind from 25 percent of the output to 20.1 percent on average, again to 8.4 percent in 1959.
					
					 In 1966 the agricultural tax in kind was eliminated completely in the country, leaving only a small amount of income taxes from white and blue collar workers intact.
					
					 Kim Il Sung promulgated the law "On Abolishing the Tax System" at the Third Session of the Fifth Supreme People's Assembly to finally abolish taxation.
					
					 Now the Korean people receive great benefits from the state instead of paying taxes.

articles.title: KCNA Slams Ministry of Unification of S. Korea
articles.content:
KCNA Slams Ministry of Unification of S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Unification, an organ specializing in the reunification issue in south Korea, is becoming notorious as "ministry of confrontation and separation."
					 Minister Hyon In Thaek is to blame for this as he has stoked north-south confrontation quite contrary to the nation's desire for reunification. 
					
					 This diehard confrontation maniac has made a specialty of inciting confrontation between fellow countrymen. Its clear proof is the new year work plan on the ministry's role. 
					
					 In the plan he called for making preparations for "unification through absorption" with 2011 as the "first year of preparations for unification". And at a recent commemorative event he talked about the "radical change of the north." 
					
					 He said that "whether the north makes fundamental change in its attitude or not would serve as the most important standard for the ministry to judge policy towards the north" and that "the ministry should concentrate all efforts on leading the north to denuclearization and opening in the future." He went the lengths of setting this as "core task for peace" and "key target of the policy towards the north", adding that there can never be the discussion of other issues. 
					
					 This wicked confrontation element took the lead in doing wrongs while putting the DPRK's "abandonment of nuclear program first" as precondition for the improved north-south relations. 
					
					 He has been engrossed in escalating confrontation out of inveterate enmity toward fellow countrymen. Huge indeed are harmful consequences he brought to the north-south relations. 
					
					 The ministry's mission is said to shape policy on unification, dialogue, exchange and cooperation between the north and the south and supervise education and information service for unification. 
					
					 South Korean people think that anyone in charge of the ministry should have affinity for fellow countrymen and be able to play the role of "friendly ambassador" between the two sides. There is a point in it.
					
					 But, the south Korean authorities appointed Hyon In Thaek, a diehard separatist, as minister of Unification, defying the nation's will for reunification. This guy had called for dismantlement of the ministry, swimming against the nation's will for reunification and unity and unified development.
					
					 Just as people fear that the ministry headed by him would run off the track sooner or later, he brought to naught all the achievements the north and the south made through dialogue and negotiations after the publication of the June 15 joint declaration. 
					
					 He cooked up the watchwords of "no nuke, opening and 3000 dollars" running diametrically counter to the historic June 15 joint declaration and October 4 declaration. When different social standings of south Korea called for getting reconciled with the north and having open-hearted dialogue with it, he insisted on "wait-and-see strategy", keeping on the north-south confrontation. 
					
					 Visits and contacts of many reunification movement organizations and personages were blocked and even NGOs' small cooperation stopped by standard and check-bar dropped by him. 
					
					 It is great misfortune and disaster that such element holds the post of minister of Unification, going on the rampage to drive the north-south relations to total collapse while seeking separation, not unification. 
					
					 It is impossible to expect implementation of the north-south joint declarations and improved inter-Korean relations unless the minister of Unification is replaced in south Korea.
					
					 The source of misfortune should be removed in time.

articles.title: Unity of All Anti-imperialist Independent Forces Called for
articles.content:
Unity of All Anti-imperialist Independent Forces Called for
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Only when all the anti-imperialist independent forces in the world get united close in their actions, can they defeat the imperialists making last-ditch efforts and accelerate the building of an independent new world.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The building of an independent new world is a struggle related to development and prosperity of the whole world and the destiny of mankind, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The unity of the anti-imperialist independent forces means, in essence, unity among those countries opposed to imperialism and desirous of independence.
					
					 The stronger they grow, the faster an independent new world will appear.
					
					 It is an important requirement for ensuring the unity of the anti- imperialist independent forces to frustrate the imperialists' splittist and alienating moves.
					
					 If the anti-imperialist independent forces are to get united, they should not be taken in by the psychological campaign of the imperialists to drive a wedge among countries and stir up division.
					
					 Only when they get united and carry on their struggle, can they break the outdated and unfair, present international order and build instead a new and fair international order.
					
					 Their unity should be achieved by way of boosting mutual cooperation and solidarity on the principle of respecting and protecting the sovereignty and interests of each country.
					
					 It is the consistent policy of the DPRK to unite close with all the countries and peoples of the world advocating independence. The DPRK will as ever make a positive contribution to accelerating the building of an independent new world, concludes the article.

articles.title: Forced Dismissal of Workers Decried in S. Korea
articles.content:
Forced Dismissal of Workers Decried in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Civic and religious organizations and opposition parties of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on March 16 denouncing the authorities' unpopular rule. 
					 They included the Solidarity for Democratic Society, the Confederation of Trade Unions and the Pastorate Council for Realizing Justice and Peace. 
					
					 Speakers at the conference charged that the Ssangyong Motors, the Hanjin Heavy Industry, the Daewoo Motors and other enterprises dismissed workers at random, driving them to death. The enterprises cited the layoff system as a pretext and this dismissal was carried out under the patronage of the "government" and the "Grand National Party".
					
					 Voices calling for settling the issue are increasing in all parts of south Korea, they said, adding that the "government" and the GNP turned a deaf ear to those voices and are pressing for the policy of stamping out the trade unions.
					
					 They declared that 71 political parties and civic and religious organizations would form an all-people committee for withdrawing the layoff and honoring the memory of victims and launch an action. 
					
					 They would probe the truth behind the layoff through the "National Assembly" and hold a NA hearing, they said.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Slashed
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Slashed
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, denounced the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises.
					 He issued a statement on Mar. 10 which said:
					
					 The imperialists are staging war exercises against socialist Korea again at a time when the Korean people are working hard to mark the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung most significantly in 2012.
					
					 The U.S. is instigating the south Korean puppet army to launch the war exercises against the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. and south Korea are making desperate efforts to provoke a war but they can never bring the Korean people to their knees. 
					
					 Yankees should know that they can not touch even a blade of grass of the DPRK. 
					
					 The progressive political parties of the world bitterly reject any attempt to invade the DPRK. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces are running whole gamut of intrigues together with the reckless military exercises to stifle socialist Korea. 
					
					 Their provocation will get them nowhere. And it will spark off the Korean people's bitter hatred for them. 
					
					 Socialist Korea with the invincible Korean People's Army will deal a decisive counterattack to the U.S. imperialist aggressors and the south Korean puppet forces.

articles.title: Kim Hyong Jik's Feats Praised
articles.content:
Kim Hyong Jik's Feats Praised
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The world public spoke highly of the feats by Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter. 
					 The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea said in its bulletin that Kim Hyong Jik was an outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea. He provided an ideological and moral source of the Juche idea, the Songun idea which serves as an idea guiding socialist Korea today, it added. 
					
					 The chief of the French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Idea said that Kim Hyong Jik dedicated his whole life to the sacred struggle for the country's independence. He was inspired by ardent patriotism and indomitable revolutionary spirit that one should fight it out against the Japanese imperialists generation after generation to liberate the country, the chief added.
					
					 The Pakistani paper Baluchistan Times noted that Kim Hyong Jik played the role of pioneer in changing the course of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea from the nationalist movement to the proletarian revolution.
					
					 The chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea said that Kim Hyong Jik clarified that a genuine way for the development of the national liberation movement was the independent struggle of the nation. At that time the world was not yet much engaged in the issue of the national liberation struggle in colony, he added. 
					
					 The Egypt-Korea Friendship Association carried in its bulletin an article saying that it was the noteworthy feat by Kim Hyong Jik that he brought up President Kim Il Sung to be a great revolutionary. 
					
					 Nepal's newspaper The Majodur said that his idea of "Jiwon" (aim high) has been successfully carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: New Indian Organization Formed
articles.content:
New Indian Organization Formed
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Indian Center for Self-Reliance and Independence Studies was formed with due ceremony in Chandigarh on March 15.
					 Present at the ceremony were personages of different circles in India and the director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and the director general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea. 
					
					 At the ceremony they underlined the need to study in depth the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and thoroughly apply it to the reality of India.

articles.title: CSTO Working Group Meets in Tajikistan
articles.content:
CSTO Working Group Meets in Tajikistan
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A working group of the foreign ministers' council of the Collective Security Treaty Organization (CSTO) met in Dushanbe, Tajikistan, on March 16 and 17.
					 Attending the meeting were delegates of CSTO member nations including Russia, Belarus, Kazakhstan and Tajikistan.
					
					 It dealt with issues of defending the regional security and sovereignty from terrorism and extremism as well as a series of international matters.
					
					 A statement was released at the end of the meeting.

articles.title: Protection of Regional Security Called for
articles.content:
Protection of Regional Security Called for
						
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Nikolai Borzhzya, secretary of the Collective Security Treaty Organization, at a recent meeting called for protecting regional security. 
					 The Afghan war still goes on and steps taken for stability there have not yet brought affirmative results, he said. It is threatening the security of the member nations of the Organization. 
					
					 He underlined the need for all the member nations to unite close to ensure the regional security.

articles.title: Radioactivity Monitoring Center Goes Operational in China
articles.content:
Radioactivity Monitoring Center Goes Operational in China
 Beijing, March 19 (KCNA) -- The Radioactivity Monitoring Center went fully operational in China from Mar. 12 in connection with the leakage of radioactive materials from the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant in Japan.
					 A leading official of the Chinese Ministry of Environmental Protection said, when interviewed by media, that no abnormal phenomenon was detected across the country by that time and all the nuclear power plants were operating in a normal state.

articles.title: China Intensifies Political Work among Militia and Reserve Units
articles.content:
China Intensifies Political Work among Militia and Reserve Units
 Beijing, March 19 (KCNA) -- The general offices of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC), the State Council and the Central Military Commission (CMC) recently issued regulations on political work among militia and the reserve units of the Chinese People's Liberation Army. 
					 The regulations stipulate in a systematic way the guiding idea, basic principle and main contents of the political work among militia and the reserve units. They followed the recommendations of the C.C., CPC, the State Council and the CMC on intensifying the political work among militia and reserve units in keeping with the rules on the CPLA political work and the new situation.

articles.title: CPLA Soldiers Render Help to Dig Wells
articles.content:
CPLA Soldiers Render Help to Dig Wells
 Beijing, March 19 (KCNA) -- Soldiers in Beijing and Lanzhou military areas of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (CPLA) are rendering help in digging wells as part of measures against drought damage in Shandong, Henan and Hebei provinces of the country.
					 38 wells had been sunk in those provinces by more than 1,000 service persons of the CPLA in the above-said areas as of Mar. 10.
					
					 The completion of the wells made it possible to solve the issue of drinking water for at least one million people in rural areas and water more than 73,000 wu of cropland.

articles.title: 2,603 Million Trees Planted in China Last Year
articles.content:
2,603 Million Trees Planted in China Last Year
 Beijing, March 20 (KCNA) -- China conducted all-people compulsory tree-planting activities last year, remarkably improving the ecological environment. 
					 A total of 590 million people of different circles joined the activities across the country. 
					
					They planted 2,603 million trees of various species.

articles.title: Israeli Spying Device Dismantled by Lebanese Army
articles.content:
Israeli Spying Device Dismantled by Lebanese Army
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- An Israeli spying device was dismantled recently in south Lebanon. 
					 The Lebanese army said it in a statement on Mar. 17. 
					
					 The spying device, which was camouflaged inside a rock, took and transmitted photographs and was capable of monitoring a 15 km stretch of Lebanon's southern coast.

articles.title: Demonstration against Nukes in Germany
articles.content:
Demonstration against Nukes in Germany
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A demonstration against nukes was recently staged in Baden-Wurttemberg State, Germany.
					 The demonstrators protested against the government's nuclear policy in the wake of the explosions at nuclear power plants in Japan. They included members of the Social-Democratic Party, the Greens and several organizations for environmental protection, more than 60,000 people in all.
					
					 They formed a human chain from the state government building to a nuclear power plant 45 kilometers away from it. They strongly urged the authorities to close down the plant.

articles.title: No-Smoking Decision in Belgium
articles.content:
No-Smoking Decision in Belgium
						
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Belgium made no-smoking decision on Mar. 16.
					 According to it, smoking in public places shall be banned from coming July 1 and those who violate it be fined.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il respetado por Jong Ju Yong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il respetado por Jong Ju Yong
Pyongyang, 21 de marzo (ATCC) -- Se cumplen 10 anos desde el fallecimiento del ex presidente honorario del Grupo Hyundai del Sur de Corea, Jong Ju Yong.
					  Desde cuando se entrevisto con el Dirigente       Kim Jong Il hasta los ultimos momentos de su vida, Jong respetaba al primero considerandolo como el sol de la nacion y el centro de reunificacion de la patria y gran unidad nacional.
					
					  Tras reunirse con el Dirigente en su visita a Pyongyang realizada a finales de octubre de 1998, elogio a el como el mejor de los generales.
					
					  Dijo a sus colegas que el General Kim Jong Il es valiente, franco y magnanimo y anadio con emocion que le parece un hecho consumado la reunificacion del pais.
					
					  El Dirigente Kim Jong Il es gran hombre de verdad como me habian contado, senalo y continuo: 
					
					El confia en mi aunque me dedique solo a los negocios ignorando la division de la patria. 
					
					Vivire el resto de mi vida para el cumplimiento de la sagrada causa de reunificacion confiando y siguiendo unicamente al Dirigente capaz de conducir el pais y la nacion coreana a la reconciliacion y a la reunificacion.
					
					En una entrevista de prensa concedida sobre la visita de Jong a Pyongyang, un periodista surcoreano le pregunto por que llamaba como General al Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Entonces, Jong respondio en tono firme que lo hacia porque todo el mundo llama asi al Dirigente.
					
					  El gran respeto de Jong Ju Yong hacia el Dirigente conmueve hasta hoy a los habitantes surcoreanos.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias a So Man Sul
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias a So Man Sul 
Pyongyang, 21 de marzo (ATCC) -- En relacion con que las organizaciones de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon) y los coreanos residentes en Tohoku y otras zonas perifericas sufrieron grandes perdidas humanas y materiales debido al gran terremoto y tsunami, el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio este lunes a So Man Sul, presidente del Presidium del Comite Central de la Chongryon, un mensaje de condolencias.
					En la misiva, Kim destaco que el Presidium del CC de la Chongryon tomo medidas emergentes cuando se produjo inesperadamente el gran sismo y despliega activamente actividades socorristas para proteger la vida valiosa y los bienes de los compatriotas en la region damnificada y anadio que esto muestra la fuerza unida de la Chongryon.
					
					Deseo con toda sinceridad que todas las organizaciones de la Chongryon y los coreanos residentes en Japon recuperen cuanto antes los danos causados por el terremoto y estabilicen la vida mostrando su indoblegable voluntad, calida fraternidad y fuerza unida.

articles.title: Comienza en Corea la produccion de tela de vinalon
articles.content:
Comienza en Corea la produccion de tela de vinalon
Pyongyang, 21 de marzo (ATCC) -- Los funcionarios y la clase obrera de la Fabrica Textil de Lana de Hamhung acondicionaron magnificamente el proceso de produccion de hilo con la fibra en cinta de vinalon e iniciaron la produccion de la tela de esta fibra.
					Al reconstruirse el taller de estiramiento y cortadura de fibra, fue sentada la base de tejer cualquier tipo de tela de vinalon, de manera que esta fibra contribuyera grandemente al mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y al desarrollo industrial del pais.
					
					El taller de mantenimiento, el de arreglo de equipos y el de produccion de piezas de hilado fabricaron con exito casi 100 mil accesorios importantes y articulos de hilado de mas de 140 tipos resolviendo por cuenta propia los problemas cientifico-tecnicos surgidos en la reconstruccion tecnica en estrecha cooperacion con los funcionarios y tecnicos del Ministerio de Industria Ligera y la Direccion de la Industria Textil. 
					
					Se impulsaron energicamente la reconstruccion tecnica para mantener eficazmente la temperatura y la humedad en los talleres y la obra de la red de abastecimiento energetico y facilidades interiores, lo cual dio condiciones suficientes para adelantar la modernizacion de procesos productivos.
					
					  Los funcionarios y obreros de la fabrica aceleraron al mismo tiempo la enorme obra de traslado de decenas de equipos de elaboracion de fibra al Complejo de Vinalon 8 de Febrero con vistas a completar racionalmente los procesos de produccion.
					
					  Los funcionarios del centro y la provincia ayudaron mucho a los obreros de la fabrica en la renovacion de equipos.
					
					  Por consiguiente, quedo establecido el simple y rentable sistema de produccion de tela de vinalon con la fibra en cinta.

articles.title: ATCC critica al ministro de Reunificacion del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
ATCC critica al ministro de Reunificacion del Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 21 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Ministerio de Reunificacion del Sur de Corea, organo encargado de los asuntos de reunificacion, gana la mala fama de "Ministerio de Confrontacion y Division".
					Este pronombre que circula entre los habitantes surcoreanos se debe al ministro Hyon In Thaek, connotado elemento conflictivo que insiste en la confrontacion fratricida desafiando de continuo a la aspiracion nacional sobre la reunificacion.
					
					La naturaleza de Hyon ha sido demostrada claramente a traves del plan de trabajo del ano nuevo sobre el papel de esa cartera.
					
					Hyon senalo en ese plan que haria de 2011 el "primer ano de los preparativos para la reunificacion" y prepararia activamente la "reunificacion a modo de absorcion".
					
					Y peroro en una ceremonia efectuada recientemente sobre el "cambio fundamental del Norte".
					
					Dijo que "la importante norma de su organo para juzgar la politica sobre el Norte dependera del cambio fundamental de la actitud del Norte" y "hay que concentrar todas fuerzas para que el Norte tome el camino de desnuclearizacion y apertura al extranjero".
					
					Destaco que eso es indiscutible porque es la "tarea nuclear por la paz" y la "meta fundamental de la politica sobre el Norte".
					
					Hyon actua con frenesi presentando la "renuncia nuclear primero" como condicion previa de mejoramiento de las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Son muy grandes las consecuencias negativas de su postura conflictiva que recayeron en las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					El Ministerio de Reunificacion del Sur de Corea, cuyo antecesor es el consejo de reunificacion del regimen, tiene las obligaciones de elaborar las politicas relacionadas con la reunificacion, el dialogo, el intercambio y la cooperacion con el Norte y dirigir la educacion y la propaganda sobre la reunificacion.
					
					Los surcoreanos consideran que el ministro de Reunificacion debe ser una persona sociable capaz de cumplir el papel de "embajador amistoso" para ambas partes.
					
					Pero, en desafio frontal a la aspiracion nacional a la reunificacion, la unidad y el desarrollo unificado, las autoridades surcoreanas nombraron a Hyon In Thaek, que antes de tomar el cargo, abogaba por abolir el Ministerio de Reunificacion.
					
					Como todo el mundo se preocupaba, el echo a perder todos los exitos alcanzados por el Norte y el Sur mediante el dialogo y las negociaciones sostenidos tras publicada la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio.
					
					Al oponerse obstinadamente a la historica Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y a la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre, invento la doctrina de "desnuclearizacion, la apertura, 3 000 dolares" del Norte.
					
					Cuando los habitantes surcoreanos de diferentes sectores demandaban reconciliarse y dialogar sinceramente con el Norte, Hyon prolongo la confrontacion fratricida insistiendo en que "esperar es una estrategia tambien".
					
					Debido a la norma y obstaculos fabricados por el, se interrumpieron el viaje reciproco y el contacto entre numerosas entidades y personalidades del movimiento por la reunificacion.
					
					Para colmo, quedo impedido caso por caso hasta las pequenas labores de cooperacion impulsadas por las entidades civiles.
					
					Es una gran desgracia y desastre tener a el en ese cargo.
					
					Sin sustituirlo, no se puede esperar jamas la ejecucion de las declaraciones conjuntas N-S ni mejorar las relaciones entre estas partes.
					
					Hay que eliminar a tiempo la causa del mal.

articles.title: Genaro Ledesma condena ejercicios belicos EE.UU.-Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Genaro Ledesma condena ejercicios belicos EE.UU.-Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 21 de marzo (ATCC) -- Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, presidente del Frente Obrero, Campesino, Estudiantil y Popular del Peru, hizo publica el dia 10 una declaracion condenando el entrenamiento militar conjunto de Estados Unidos y el Sur de Corea.
					La nota senala que los imperialistas vuelven a perpetrar el ejercicio de guerra de agresion contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea cuando el pueblo coreano lucha por celebrar de modo mas significativo el centenario en 2012 de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					Apunta que EE.UU. moviliza a dicho entrenamiento su subalterno ejercito titere surcoreano y anade que el imperio y el Sur de Corea se aventuran para provocar la guerra, pero, no podran doblegar jamas al pueblo coreano.
					
					Destaca que los yanquis deben darse cuenta de que no podran tocar ni una mata de hierba de Corea.
					
					Asevera que los partidos politicos progresistas del mundo condenan rotundamente la intencion de agresion a Corea.
					
					Senala que para aplastar a la Corea socialista, los titeres surcoreanos se aferran a los complots de toda indole para no hablar del brutal entrenamiento militar.
					
					Hace hincapie en que tal provocacion de ellos es vana y ocasionara solo el odio del pueblo coreano.
					
					Concluye que Corea socialista, que cuenta con el invencible Ejercito Popular de Corea, asestara demoledor contraataque a los agresores yanquis y los titeres surcoreanos.
